reviews.review_msg: going to lecture is a major waste of time but the slides are confusing on their own so pick your poison. he doesn't upload the notes ahead of time which would've been fine if he wasn't so hard to follow. half the time you can't hear him and the other half he rambles on and on about things you don't even need to know. just take it with a diff prof

His office hours were amazing (probs why I got an A+). He asks you questions so you can actually understand the material. His lectures are pointless to go to. Read the lectures, go to office hours, and do objective list (practice test not that similar). His tests require you to very much know the material via lectures and the objective list.

Lectures and slide decks are unclear and confusing--he goes off topic a lot during the lecture. Make sure to keep up with the objectives from day 1; they are like a vocabulary list to understand the heavy science jargon in his slides. His class is quite messy and unorganized. Avoid him if possible!!

Dr. Young is a good prof and cares that his students do well. His slides are messy but they contain all the information needed. He is very clear about the testable material and provides lots of practice. At the beginning of every lecture he did open review on the previous lectures content. I recommend taking MBB 222 with him.
Wanted very specific answers for the exam, honestly didn't learn much in lecture. And you will definitely be picked on in lecture.

I really like Dr. Young. I understand some of the ratings because some of the test questions can be confusing(material is hard). BUT he is a great prof, he will sit at office hours with you and really explain things, he also wants you to understand and be capable of explaining things back to him. He's not a “memorize” type of prof.

I honestly really enjoy his class. He provides clear objectives for each week, and only the items on that list are examinable. His exams are fair, he records his lectures, and he is very accessible. The only downside is that the exams can feel a bit rushed, but overall, he is a very good professor. He is passionate and explains things well.

Avoid this professor. The material he expects you to know in lecture or in office hours are very simple and common sense, but he pulls up crazy long hard questions during exams with very little time. Final exam was two separate exams, each exam was 100 points and ONLY 55 minutes (no MC questions). Weird grading criteria. Also lots of homework.

I really liked Dr. Young, he was always there to help outside of class, his lecture material is bit unorganized but if you actually sort through it all of the information is there and its very thorough. His exams are very fair and if you actually go through all the lectures it's all there for you! I would definitely recommend taking it with him!!

Dr. Young's lecture style didn't work for me—he emphasized participation without incentive, making classes awkward and easy to lose track of. I ended up self-teaching most of the material. Exams were fair but tough. Weekly assignments took hours but counted for very little, which made it hard to justify the effort. I would not recommend.

Course: MBB 324 (idk why I can't select or add this course on RMP) Slides are so messy and random. Midterms were fair but still hard. Final exam has 2 parts; both insanely hard. Please never take this guy. GPA definitely took a hit.

He's a nice guy, and he presents content in memorable/engaging ways. He'll ask people for answers in class, but doesn't judge responses. Exams are fair (study the objective lists & reference sheets), but MBB321 is a tough memorization course. I can see how others think his slides are a lot, but tbh my ADHD brain would make them the same way.

Dr Young has been such a pleasure this semester! Teaches with lots of passion and a great sense of humour. Lectures were taught in person and were recorded as well, which made learning so accessible! Lots of opportunities to make up for lost marks, and the timing for exams was extremely fair imo. Tip: review learning objectives for exam prep!

Dr. Young is one of the best MBB profs there are. Teaches material clearly, fair exams, nice marking scheme, reviews topics often to help students. 321 with Dr. Young made it much easier to understand all the pathways because of his teaching style. Would 100% take another course with him

Unnecessarily complicates lectures by going into too much depth. Very messy slides filled with information, and doesn't give enough time for tests. MTs which are supposed to be 50 min are 45 minutes, and he started distributing exams after class starts. Also, some questions are out of the syllabus.

Literally, take any other professor but him.
takes advantage of students, gets away with it bc he's also a chair associate

RUDE. no care bt you as a student no matter the situation. MESSY slides, inconsistent in marking, only likes his way of teaching, will give you some notes but says they won't be relevant/what you're going to be tested on. 
his response to ANYTHING asked or any type of help/accommodation "see course policies" "contact TA"
Self-teach and stay away

Truth-not an easy course but def fun to learn. keep up with the lect* it accumulates fast. I studied Obj for exams, I recommend having obj and lect side by side when you study. Exams were fair but get ur timing right(min/q). Dr. Y an awe prof. his teaching was very logical, metaphoric, humorous.

Enthusiastic prof but does not present information in a clear and concise way. As previous readers have suggested, better to self-learn. Did not enjoy this course, material relatively easy as there are lots of resources online. His notes? Not good, crowded, and hard to navigate.

enthusiastic lecturer but holy crap UGLIEST and most cluttered slides ever, makes concepts unnecessarily difficult to understand. better off self-teaching and watching youtube videos tbh. learning objectives somewhat helpful for tests but they are also cluttered and hard to interpret at times.

Lecture slides are disorganized with lots of clutter and every week there is an objective list filled with LOTS of info on what is examinable(also cluttered). Exams are ok, I had ingrid for 222 and wish I took her for 321 instead. Edgar takes feedback though and changed how the canvas was organized but also is adamant on not posting tutorial slides

Whenever given the chance, take a class with Dr.Young, it'll really change the way you think and study biology. Dr.Young makes you find the logic and reasoning behind something to understand it rather than simply memorize. This is the most (and best) I've learnt anything bio related, and it has stuck with me. This class despite the stress was fun.

Taking MBB22 with Dr. Young was really interesting and one thing for sure, it changed the way I will ever study biology. He puts more emphasis on insights and the logical reason behind any event, instead of memorizing everything by rote. Another great thing was the writing assignments, it definitely gave me an idea on how to write scientifically.

Dr. Young is very knowledgeable, truly cares for students, and makes an effort to prepare materials for class. But if you decide to take a class with him be prepared to read from the first session. The main problem is that his course note is not suitable for his exams. However, he also posts really helpful archive notes.

Dr.Young isn't a bad prof. ONLY bad thing was he gave 45 min in midterms and for each part on the final (2 parts) instead of 50 min (and 3 hours for final) - there was barely enough time to finish even if you knew every question. If you do the readings, assignments, and go to class, you can do well BUT you have to be fast on exams
He should not be a prof. Have never come across someone as bad as him
His lectures left me more confused about the content and his slides were all over the place. It was easier learning from the slides created by other professors for this course.

the presentations were all over the place. he made the lectures difficult. his class was not enjoyable with all the stress added from 'do it yourself' situation. his tests seemed bit unfair with less time and more question, if you didn't read anything properly, you lost marks. Don't take this class if you want to actually learn.

This class is more work than an organic chemistry class and lab combined.

Every week theres an objective list that requires you to read a sht ton of textbook pages and all sorts of slides and website links to answers the questions on the objective lists and extra exercises given.

Exams were fair if you managed to survive the work.
one of the most horrific classes I've taken

He complicates things when his whole job is supposed to be breaking it down for his students. It's like he wants us to be more confused or something?? I should have listened to the reviews on here, never taking a professor with a low rating again I'm genuinely traumatized.
He is very nice but man you dont have time to think during any of his midterms. Its either you know the answer the first time you read it or you dont.
Just don't
Avoid at all costs.

The professor is nice, but his lectures are not helpful. You have to do a lot of extra reading outside of class time in order to understand what is covered during the lectures. The lecture slides are not helpful either, and consist of way too many things on a single slide in a random order. Avoid taking this class with this professor.

Prof. Young is simultaneously the nicest guy ever and the worst professor. His pdfs and lectures are confusing, and the TA is zero help. Young is so enthusiastic about the material and so likeable (which normally makes the class bearable) but seriously, he is literally the worst professor I have ever had. Take it with another professor if you can.

Was a pleasure having Dr Young teach this course. Made attending morning lectures interesting and he was always very welcoming. The grading system was student friendly, consisting of 6 exams (50 pts each), but total exam grade was only worth 250 points. Also 7 quizzes but only graded best 5. Cumulative final (last 2 exams) were pretty tough

Had quizzes every week and exams when we didn't. 6 exams worth 50 marks each for a total of 300 but only total calculated using 250. 7 quizzes worth 10 marks each for a total of 60 but only calculated using 50. Exams worth 90%, quizzes worth 10%. Hard Cumulative final exam (2 exams with a 30 minute gap)

One of my favorite professors. He really cares about his students, is a great teacher and is also pretty funny. He teaches hard classes so you need to put the effort in but as long as you follow the learning objects and his advice youll get a good grade

Excellent professor, provides you with everything you need to succeed: practice, excellent lecture slides, involved iClickers. He even took off some marks from the total of all 3 of the exams. But most importantly he is very knowledgable and very good at explaining things. Wonderful prof, if I could, I would take all of my MBB courses with him.

The lecture notes are very sparse and disorganized, with him often jumping between 4 documents on the overhead. Its better to try to learn lecture material outside of class, but attendance is mandatory due to IClicker. When asked questions during office hours he would just tell us to post the questions on piazza instead of helping in person. 0/5
Great professor. Makes you do the work but the exams are exactly what he requires you to read and learn. No tricks involved. 10/10 would take again.
He is a wonderful prof. Have Iclicker to make students go to the morning class which is good. Keep up with the review sheets.

He is an okay prof, but overhead notes written are messy and hard to read. Sometimes goes on a tangent and often you will have to go over slides that he did not present in class. Tries a bit hard to be funny. Lots of iClicker questions for credit. He gives out review lists that the exams are based on and has a fair grading system.

I thought he is a very nice and funny teacher and genuinely cares about his students doing well. Clickers almost every class for participation, gives out "cheat sheets" to follow along, slides aren't too bad, tests are very fair. Uploads his slides and whatever he writes on the overhead after every class so even if you skip a day you can catch up.

Dr Young gives you all that you need, straight up. Once you get what you have to do, which is a decent load for a course, then you're set. Follow his instructions on how to study, come to lectures for iClickers, do your readings(provided page by page) and you'll have a breeze with his course! Not your regular approach to teaching but effective.

He's a bit odd. Didn't like him at first, but as the semester progressed, he kinda grew on me. iclickers for participation every class. Slides organized weirdly with the iclickers right smack in the middle of the lecture. Uploads pdf files TO NO END. Txtbook is your friend. The entire course seems randomly organized.

Edgar uses iClickers so it forces you to go to class, but sadly, his lectures are purely useless and he goes off-topic occasionally.  His attitude towards students was quite poor and condescending as well. If I had to learn all the material myself, I wish the course would've been offered online instead.

I'm paraphrasing here, but Dr. Young stated early on that "he's not here to teach us the material, he's here to tell you how to teach yourself".  See, he originally taught MBB 222 online but decided to reuse his learning guides for the in person class so get ready to learn 100% from the textbook. Didn't learn anything in lecture. Had a bad time.

Have to learn everything from the textbook.  Lectures are a waste of time.  He makes "learning objectives" but goes over 10% of material required for the course.  I understand mbb is very difficult, and there is a lot of material, but he wastes time in class being condescending.  I'm a good student, and would recommend avoiding if possible.

In my experience, you really have to work for your grade. This class is basically a self learning course. If you don't like how Dr. Young runs his class, he literally tells you in the beginning of the semester that it's going to be like that every class. Overall, I feel that he is a fair prof as he takes off 15% of your worst quizzes and iclicker.

MBB 222 is itself a very heavy load course meaning the lectures aren't enough time for the prof to go over everything. However Dr. Young's learning guides are all you need, memorize all the vocab and your set. He also offers bonus marks on his exams which help a ton! Would definitely recommend!

Dr. Young did not TEACH us anything! Rather than going through slides about general, important topics, he would focus on minute details of the course content, leaving those who hadn't read ahead lost. Homeworks and iclickers were given on content we had not touched on in class. Midterms were fair, final BRUTAL.

Lecture was completely useless. Spent 80% of class answering student Q's & 1 or 2 Iclicker questions. Be prepared to self-teach yourself ALL the material. Had AMAZING TAs, tutorials super helpful. MT1&2 were reasonable (had 90%+ on MT's) but Final was ridiculous, left 1/3 blank. Prof is condescending & rude to students. Avoid at all costs.
Lectures are useless but you have to come because of iCliker participation marks. TAs and online resources really help.

DO NOT take this class with Professor Young! Minimal material is covered in class, so you have to spend countless hours at home teaching yourself everything that he didn't cover in lecture for every unit. Be ready to do LOTS of reading if you are taking this class with him as there are no lecture slides.

He barely teaches in class so you are expected to learn everything yourself from the textbook. The only reason I ever went to class was because of his iclickers that counted for marks. STAY AWAY from him at ALL COSTS.   He couldn't answer any questions properly and even his TA's were constantly confused as to what he wanted us to know for exams.
he made me lost all the interests about MBB, i was even wondering if i should change my major. since MBB222 is the very first MBB courses to start
Very very bad prof. Try to avoid at all costs
he's the worst prof... never teach anything, just enjoying his own jokes in class and i learned nothing from him, all i have to is to read the books and self-study, useless to go to the lecture.
Very knowledgeable and helpful during office hours. Be prepared to work for your grade.

The material for MBB424 is pretty challenging but Dr. Young is a really good lecturer and makes it do-able. He does all his notes by hand (legible) and is clearly interested in the material. Don't expect problem sets to be an easy homework mark!

I found the exams to be fair, though the second midterm was tricky. This course involves applying knowledge rather than regurgitating facts. Dr. Young is very knowledgeable and provides thorough answers to all questions presented and asked in lecture. This is not an easy course, but definitely interesting and worth taking.
Im totally speechless about this course. I swear I did not learn anything about it. Until now I still dont see how are the materials relate to one another.
Pretty hard course..but did his final help a bit or I am totally off?

Good at communicating ideas, but has a tiny voice (either that or his microphone doesn't work too well) and can make you feel a little dumb at times... Too much physics/math for a biochem course! Notes could be more organized. Exams are difficult and marking is quite subjective. The protein profile was pretty interesting, though.

course started off great and cohesive. but unfortunately ended like a train wreck. course name is protein structure and function but was more focused technical aspects of EM, crystallography, NMR. this may be great for graduates already doing protein research but unfair for undergraduates. course is definately not easy.

I advise any prospective students,do not take this teacher if you dont have to!!! Very disorganized, his tests are left to ur own interpretation yet he marks subjectively. Hated the course because of the teacher!! Don't take him!!! u were warned!!!
Sort of unorganized, but then again the material is kind of tough to understand.  Funny guy.
Problem sets will make you want to tear your eyeballs out.
DAGER     HIGHLY UNORGANIZED
